text:
I downloaded the latest trunk (r330052) and tried to beginn with the fop.bat 
batch file. After I removed the special characters in it (probably UNIX special 
line breaks), I got it started and it just prints:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/fop/cli/Ma
in
creator: mhilpert@gmx.de
manuel@apache.org
text: Did you build fop using ant before trying to run it?

creator: mhilpert@gmx.de
text:
Build fob? Do I have to? There are alreayd JAR files in the lib/ directory ... 
but yes, I can't see a fop.jar file! Why isn't it offered as a jar file? I also 
can't find a source bundle zip file, so do I really need to download all source 
files? Then I would have to install subversion, because there are so much 
source files that it takes hours to download each of them via the subversion 
link. :-(

creator: the.webmaestro@gmail.com
text:
Yes. You need to build it, as the 'trunk' version is still uncompiled 'code'. A
release is forthcoming (in a few weeks, hopefully!) but as yet the 'trunk'
version is unreleased. To use it, you must 'build' it w ant.

If you want something which is already built, you'll need to go here:

http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/download.html

Good luck!

p.s. if you have any other questions, please post them to the fop-users@ instead
of filing a 'bug'. You can find more info here:

http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/maillist.html

Cheers!

Okay, is there a forum for this? Mail lists are evel. Just for having a 
question to subscribe to such a list and receive any amount of emails every day 
that don't interest me. A forum is much more convenient. Is there any?
creator: mhilpert@gmx.de

text:
No there is no Apache hosted forum for FOP. The fop-user list is there for that 
purpose. It is not a very high volume list as a quick check of the archives 
would reveal. And you can always unsubscribe once your issues are resolved.
creator: manuel@apache.org

text:
I subscribed but can't post! I didn't found the email address where to send to 
(http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/mail.html doesn't tell), but I just got a mail 
from someone else on the list and he sent to "fop-
users@xmlgraphics.apache.org". So I also sent my question to this address but 
just got this response:

------------------------------
Hi! This is the ezmlm program. I'm managing the fop-
users@xmlgraphics.apache.org mailing list.

This is a generic help message. The message I received wasn't sent to any of my 
command addresses.


--- Administrative commands for the fop-users list ---

I can handle administrative requests automatically. Please do not send them to 
the list address! Instead, send your message to the correct command address:

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
   <fop-users-subscribe@xmlgraphics.apache.org>

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
   <fop-users-unsubscribe@xmlgraphics.apache.org>

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
   <fop-users-info@xmlgraphics.apache.org>
   <fop-users-faq@xmlgraphics.apache.org>

Similar addresses exist for the digest list:
   <fop-users-digest-subscribe@xmlgraphics.apache.org>
   <fop-users-digest-unsubscribe@xmlgraphics.apache.org>

To get messages 123 through 145 (a maximum of 100 per request), mail:
   <fop-users-get.123_145@xmlgraphics.apache.org>

To get an index with subject and author for messages 123-456 , mail:
   <fop-users-index.123_456@xmlgraphics.apache.org>

They are always returned as sets of 100, max 2000 per request, so you'll 
actually get 100-499.

To receive all messages with the same subject as message 12345, send an empty 
message to:
   <fop-users-thread.12345@xmlgraphics.apache.org>

The messages do not really need to be empty, but I will ignore their content. 
Only the ADDRESS you send to is important.

You can start a subscription for an alternate address, for 
example "john@host.domain", just add a hyphen and your address (with '=' 
instead of '@') after the command word:
<fop-users-subscribe-john=host.domain@xmlgraphics.apache.org>

To stop subscription for this address, mail:
<fop-users-unsubscribe-john=host.domain@xmlgraphics.apache.org>

In both cases, I'll send a confirmation message to that address. When you 
receive it, simply reply to it to complete your subscription.

If despite following these instructions, you do not get the desired results, 
please contact my owner at fop-users-owner@xmlgraphics.apache.org. Please be 
patient, my owner is a lot slower than I am ;-)

Hi,

I read about this error message:

    "Some content could not fit into a line/page after 50 attempts. Giving up 
to avoid an endless loop."

for <fo:external-graphic> with the workaround to add the parameter content-
width="scale-to-fit".

But I get this error message also when I include a SVG file:

    <fo:instream-foreign-object >
        <svg:svg width="120mm" height="120mm" 
xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
            <svg:image width="120mm" height="120mm" xlink:href="{$chart}"/>
        </svg:svg>
    </fo:instream-foreign-object>

I tried adding content-width="scale-to-fit" to both <svg:svg> and <svg:image> 
lines, but it doesn't work. I also played with different sizes without success.



Martin

Config: FOP 1.0dev from 01.11.2005
--------------------------------------------

As I said: I hate mailing lists ...
creator: mhilpert@gmx.de

text:
On http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/mail.html it says:

The ezmlm mailing list controller accepts commands by sending emails to 
<listname>-command, generally like the following: 

*-subscribe Subscribe your current email address to the list
creator: manuel@apache.org
gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
